					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	INNOVATOR

	Aamir is an automotive content creator and car collector who shares the journey of owning, restoring and driving classic vehicles on TikTok. He began posting content in 2020 while studying for a mechanical engineering degree and eventually transitioned to full-time content creation. On his page, you’ll find tons of automotive DIYs, reviews of new and old cars, cinematic edits and even the occasional tech video. Whether you just want to learn the basics about cars, save money by working on your daily driver, or go all out and restore your own project car, there’s a video for just about everyone.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	Working on cars can seem confusing, but I aim to present concepts and DIYs in the simplest way possible — often scripting and rewording for hours on end. Getting recognized as an Innovator means all the focus on details hasn’t gone unnoticed. In my junior year of mechanical engineering, on a whim, I decided to download TikTok and post my first video — a simple 15-second clip showing my old Mitsubishi with a trending audio. I quickly noticed an opportunity not only to showcase the cars but also to teach about them. Fast forward a few years, I graduated from college, transitioned to full-time content creation, have been able to work with a ton of dream automotive companies and met a majority of my closest friends — all through TikTok.
	
		What or who inspires you?	

	My mom, my colleagues and friends who are always pushing the boundaries of content creation. Anyone who pursues their passion, whether it’s a hobby or a job.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Creative, methodical, easy-going.

		
			
			
	Thomas Duke, @steppingthroughfilm (London, England)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	INNOVATOR

	Thomas Duke is a creator from London who lives and breathes the world of film and TV. Being inspired by the screen since he was 5 years old, it’s been a dream for Thomas to share his passion with his acting and directing inspirations through film junkets and set visits, connecting with them through his love for the arts on TikTok and digging deep into what makes cinema so special for us all. His trusted little film journal — which he’s kept going for 16 years now — comes in handy to help conjure up nostalgic conversations about the magic of the movies and its presence in our lives.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	As a lover of all things creative, it’s a true pleasure to be nominated on this list. It’s been a surreal journey sharing my love for film online, and a journey I never thought would get me here. The magic of film inspires me every single day. It has allowed me to reach audiences all over the world in such a beautiful, personal way. It’s given me a voice that would possibly never have reached who it has if I hadn’t started posting videos.
	
		What or who inspires you? 	

	My mum got me to this point in so many ways; she inspires me every day and makes me want to carry on. Second to that, multiple people from the screen — in front of and behind the camera — who have such a drive to create their vision for us to enjoy for decades to come. And I’d have to say, the idea of never knowing what the future holds… and waking up every day knowing you can make a difference in the world. Keep going.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Passionate, intentful, creative.

		
			
			
	Xixi Liu & Allen Fu, @cheekyglo (Sydney, Australia)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Xixi Liu and Allen Fu are the co-founders of CheekyGlo, an Australian skin and haircare brand. Xixi is a creator and entrepreneur who shares her exciting journey as a bootstrapped beauty founder. She brings hands-on industry experience and passion to building CheekyGlo. Inspired by her own skin insecurities, she co-founded the brand with a desire to help others feel seen, confident and comfortable in their skin. Allen is a seasoned entrepreneur and operator focused on building and scaling his ventures. With a background spanning science, consulting and sales, he brings a practical, evidence-informed approach to growing CheekyGlo. He is committed to inclusive self-care, with a focus on creating accessible skincare solutions for men who want to take better care of their skin.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	As early adopters of TikTok in Australia, we quickly built our own personal brands alongside using the platform to launch CheekyGlo. It’s a great honor to be recognized for the impact we’ve made and the community we’ve built. Our product first sold out in 48 hours after we posted it on TikTok, and since then, the platform has given us the opportunity to share our brand with the world. We’ve used it as a foundation to create businesses that educate, entertain and positively impact people. The platform has also enabled us to hire dozens of people, move into a warehouse we once only imagined, support our families and access opportunities that simply didn’t exist before. Watching it grow beyond our expectations has been incredibly rewarding.
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	Allen: Alex Hormozi.
	
		Describe yourself in three words. 	

	Xixi: Passionate, honest, real.

		
			
			
	Cherie Kihato, @cheriekihato (Nairobi, Kenya)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Cherie is a creative entrepreneur and founder of Savannah Space, a Kenyan design studio and showroom showcasing heritage through furniture, art and interiors. Her platform inspires a global audience of design lovers, makers and aspiring creatives by documenting her journey and sharing tools that make creative business work possible. She also shares lifestyle and fashion content with a focus on African artistry.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	It means that my message that Africans and African brands should be highlighted and respected is being noticed. This is such an honor, as it’s so important for us as Africans to showcase what incredible things are coming out of our continent. Being nominated as an Originator proves to me that the risk I took in sharing my journey of building an African brand is resonating with so many people. I’m incredibly proud of that. Creating on TikTok has played a huge role in my confidence journey. It pushed me far outside my comfort zone. It’s opened up so many unexpected opportunities, but more than that, it’s allowed me to build a really special community of people who genuinely support me and are rooting for the growth and success of my brand.
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	Tracee Ellis Ross is an entrepreneur — and person in general — who I gain so much inspiration from. She is authentically herself and is building an incredible brand by being so. Also, Hermès! They have shown that it is possible to be an artisanal, heritage-focused brand with a global presence.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Child of God, storyteller, learner.

		
			
			
	Elyse Burns, @elysebreannedesign (North Carolina)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Elyse Breanne is an artist and small business owner who grew her side-hustle Etsy shop into a multimillion-dollar business while attending law school by sharing her small business journey on TikTok. She graduated from Duke Law in 2022 and took her business full-time, opening a storefront a few months later, and started growing her team. Now, she has a team of 16 full-time employees, a 14,000-square-foot warehouse and over $15 million in all-time revenue. She continues to create new art, develop new products and document every success and challenge she faces as a small-business owner through her content on TikTok.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	I am honored to be nominated as an Originator. TikTok has been integral to the success of my business, and as someone with no background in art or business, being able to share my journey and learn from others through TikTok has been indispensable. I owe a lot to TikTok, and it is exciting to be nominated as someone who is also contributing to this community. TikTok has completely reshaped my life and career in extremely tangible ways. Without TikTok helping expand my business 18x in 2020, I would currently be a lawyer and probably living in another state. Instead, I have gotten to pursue my dream career as an artist and business owner, open a stationery storefront in my community and create 16 full-time jobs as well.
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	Simplified by Emily Ley.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Creative, fun-loving, practical.

		
			
			
	Ghina Eroz, @gweroz (Jakarta, Indonesia)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Ghina Eroz is a dreamer from Indonesia who has become many of the things she loves — a creator, a storyteller, an inspiration and an entrepreneur. She built her business around her passion: telling stories that inspire. “GEROZ” is her brand name, but also her nickname. She started making innovative foods at the end of 2024, selling them creatively through TikTok. Now, as she builds her business, she is on a new mission: to travel the world and tell stories to inspire people even more.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	I built my business, and now I sell my innovative products in my own fun and creative way that catches people’s attention and also interests them in buying my products. Being nominated as an Originator means that, as far as my business goes, I have succeeded in creating an impact in a unique way — in MY way. With TikTok, I have achieved a lot of the things that I want to be and do, my voice is being heard and my stories matter. TikTok has changed how I see opportunities and values around me. Without TikTok, my ideas and business wouldn’t have come to life as they are now.
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	My mom and my family. I come from an entrepreneurial family, and everyone in my family has created a small business in our lives to hopefully make a living from.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Dreamer, persevering, joyful.

		
			
			
	Dominique Bogle, @hairanatomyuk (Birmingham, England)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Dom is the founder of Hair Anatomy U.K., a fast-growing hair brand known for making synthetic wigs and wig care feel easy, premium,and confidence-boosting. She scaled the business from a small start-up into a multi–six-figure brand through TikTok Shop, building a loyal community by teaching real, practical wig tips.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	Being nominated as an Originator on the Discover List is a significant honor and a meaningful recognition of the work I’ve put into building a trusted brand and community through TikTok Live. TikTok became the platform that allowed me to scale quickly by turning product education and demonstration into a direct sales channel through TikTok Shop and TikTok Live, and it ultimately gave me the confidence and momentum to leave my banking career and pursue entrepreneurship full-time. Beyond revenue, TikTok helped me build a highly engaged community and a strong brand presence by enabling real-time interaction, trust-building and feedback that have directly shaped my product development and customer experience. It has also expanded my professional opportunities from partnerships and collaborations to increased visibility and credibility, and ultimately changed what I believed was possible for a small business to achieve.
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	I look up to P. Louise and Made by Mitchell — both have built standout brands by combining bold product innovation with strong storytelling and community-led marketing. They’ve shown how consistency, personality and direct-to-consumer focus can turn a beauty brand into a movement, not just a product line.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Strategic, entrepreneurial, customer-focused.

		
			
			
	Jeffrey Morrison, @morrisonmade (Kentucky, United States)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	MorrisonMade is a small family business in Northern Kentucky. The company was founded in 2019 and is dedicated to producing the highest quality leather goods in the United States. Each product is handcrafted by a husband-and-wife team with the highest attention to detail.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	It is always an honor to take part in these kinds of things for a company and an app that has had such an amazing impact on my life and my family’s life. It has set my life on a trajectory I never thought possible with the opportunities it has brought our business.
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	Trayvax.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	All about family.

		
			
			
	Carmen Fiorito, @newmartina (Naples, Italy)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Carmen Fiorito started sharing her work in her father’s phone shop on TikTok, and in a short time, the videos in which she changed protective films on smartphones with an unusual and engaging style went viral (one of them reached over 470 million views). Thanks to her success on TikTok, she helped her family expand their business, hire staff and open new shops in different Italian cities. New Martina has now become a leading brand in electronic device protection, recognized for its high-quality products and attentive, efficient customer service. Trusted by celebrities from film, television, sports, music and mostly normal people, New Martina has become a beloved brand with over 10 million followers on TikTok, a loyal global community, drawn to its innovation, attention to detail and unwavering customer service.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	I am so proud and honored to be nominated as an Originator! TikTok was the platform where everything started for me in 2023, and even today, it continues to give me so much satisfaction as I grow my company even more. TikTok has made my company what it is today, changing my company for the better, allowing me to reach millions of people and, above all, to open many stores throughout Italy.
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	My favorite brand is Apple, along with Steve Jobs. I absolutely love their way of communicating and marketing, as well as their consistently innovative and original products.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Courageous, ambitious, stubborn.

		
			
			
	Ning Cheah, @thebeautycrop (London, England)
			
										
					Image Credit: TiikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Ning is the founder and CEO of The Beauty Crop, a clean beauty brand that has become known for its high-performing, plant-based products that don’t compromise on fun, affordability or ethics. With a background in chemical engineering and a high-powered career in investment banking, Ning’s personal struggle with eczema and cystic acne led her to launch The Beauty Crop in 2014. Since launching, it has become a cult favorite, stocked in major retailers like Boots, Beauty Bay, ASOS and Look Fantastic.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	As the founder of The Beauty Crop, it’s proof that showing up consistently, building in public and growing with our community actually matters. We didn’t just follow trends — we helped create them through TikTok Live, real conversations and products shaped by our audience. This nomination is a reminder that small brands can lead culture, not chase it — and I am so proud of what we’ve built together. TikTok’s transformed how I’ve built The Beauty Crop — from how products are launched to how customers discover and connect with us. TikTok Live allowed me to build the brand in real time, have honest conversations with our community and turn feedback straight into product innovation. TikTok gave me a platform to show the real side of being a founder — the wins, the setbacks, the unfiltered moments — and that transparency is what’s built trust. Most importantly, TikTok proved that you don’t need a huge budget to build something meaningful — you need consistency, authenticity and the courage to show up.
	
		Who is an icon you look up to? 	

	Sara Blakely of Spanx.
	
		Describe yourself in three words. 	

	Resilient, mission-driven, unfiltered.

		
			
			
	Tamia Nontsikelelo, @tolthema (Johannesburg, South Africa)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Tamia Nontsikelelo is a creator from South Africa who uses storytelling and marketing on TikTok to create powerful, engaged communities. Through these skills, she grew a loyal audience around her modest fashion brand, Tol’thema, leading to exponential growth in a short span of time. She now uses her platform to share her entrepreneurship journey, insights and practical lessons with other creators and entrepreneurs.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	Being nominated as an Originator on the Discover List is a powerful affirmation of the work I’ve done to build more than just a business on TikTok. It represents the impact of creating products, stories and conversations that resonate deeply with people and turn viewers into a genuine community. TikTok has completely transformed my life and career. It quite literally blew up my small business and became the single most effective marketing tool I have ever used. Because of the exposure and support from TikTok, I was able to scale my brand, create jobs and build a real team. It has not only transformed my business but also changed my personal life by opening doors, creating opportunities and allowing me to step fully into my purpose as an entrepreneur.
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	Daniel Priestley.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Unwavering, visionary, intentional.

		
			
			
	Jane Hastings, @toystoystoys.uk (Liverpool, England)
			
										
					Image Credit: TikTok/Angella Choe @angellachoe				
					
				

	ORIGINATOR

	Jane Hastings is an independent toy retailer based in Liverpool who loves toys and supporting her local community. She now has the best TikTok community. Since launching on TikTok, it has changed Jane’s life.
	
		What does it mean to be recognized on the Discover List?	

	I’m over the moon to be nominated. It makes me very emotional. TikTok has changed my life unbelievably, and many others through my account. Selling on TikTok Shop has completely transformed my business, and it’s helped me keep my much-loved shop doors open on my local high street. It’s fast, it’s fun, and most importantly, I have a chance to connect directly with the people who love my products!
	
		Who is an entrepreneur, brand, or business that you look up to? 	

	Sylvanian Families! The brand has supported me with my TikTok Shop Lives from the very start.
	
		Describe yourself in three words.	

	Funny, caring, generous.

		
	
	


	
		More from Variety
	
	
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
					

			
			
			
			
	
			
			
	
			
		

		

	
		More From Our Brands

title: Eddie Van Halen's Famed Electric Guitar Could Fetch $1.5 Million at Auction
description:
Eddie Van Halen
                          Prized Electric Guitar Goes Up For Auction ...
body:
Eddie Van Halen
                          Prized Electric Guitar Goes Up For Auction ...
                          Anyone Got a Spare Mil?!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 25, 2026
                            1:00 AM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 25, 2026
                                4:25 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          When you think of legendary rock guitarists, Eddie Van Halen immediately pops into your mind ... and so do his equally famous Kramer Guitars -- and one of them can now be all yours ... but only if you have some very deep pockets!
      
    
          That's right ... the late music virtuoso's striped 1985 Kramer studio guitar is hitting the auction block on GottaHaveRockAndRoll.com starting today, through March 13.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          And the piece of guitar history is expected to fetch between $1,000,000 and $1,500,000, with a starting bid of $700,000.
      

          By the way, there's a whole story behind this Van Halen guitar ... Eddie presented his prized possession to a gentleman named Michael Gutierrez, who entered a 1985 contest during the NAMM guitar show.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The contest was titled, "One lucky winner will win one of Eddie Van Halen's personally owned Kramer Guitars."
      
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          More than 100,000 people signed up for it, and, guess what ... Gutierrez was the lucky winner! And get this ... he's also the consignor in the auction, meaning he will deliver the guitar right to the highest bidder.

title: Father of Slain Cheerleader Called for Welfare Check Before Bodies Found
description:
Cheer Mom Presumed Murder-Suicide
                          Father Called Police to Check on Daug
body:
Cheer Mom Presumed Murder-Suicide
                          Father Called Police to Check on Daughter
                          ...Prior to Their Bodies Being Found
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 24, 2026
                            6:23 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 24, 2026
                                7:51 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The father of Utah cheerleader Addi Smith called in a welfare check to Vegas cops after not being able to reach his daughter ... hours before authorities discovered her and her mother's bodies, TMZ has learned.
      
    
          According to a police report obtained by TMZ ... Addi's father, Bradley Smith, called the cops to check on his 11-year-old daughter and ex-wife, Tawnia McGeehan, at the Rio Hotel & Casino February 15 after he hadn't heard from Addi in a while.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Once arriving at the scene, officers initially knocked on the door of the hotel room and called into the room several times without success. When they called Bradley back to see if he thought Addi could be in danger, Bradley told them he didn't believe that was the case and that she "should be safe with her mom," according to the report.
      

          Then, police say officers left ... but hotel security continued their search. After friends and coaches alerted security that Tawnia and Addi never showed up for the cheerleading competition they were in town for, security made entry into their room and discovered their bodies lying lifeless on the bed.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          As we reported ... police believe Tawnia shot Addi late Saturday, February 14, while they were in Vegas for a cheerleading competition, with what appeared to be a suicide note left behind.
      
    
          Tawnia and Bradley were awarded joint legal and physical custody of Addi with one week on and one week off in 2024 after a lengthy custody battle.
      
    
          If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, help is available. Call or text 988 or chat 988lifeline.org.

title: Donald Trump Calls Democrats 'Crazy' During State of the Union
description:
Donald Trump's 2026 SOTU
                          State of Confusion!!!
body:
Donald Trump's 2026 SOTU
                          State of Confusion!!!
                          Chaos Erupts As Trump Goes After Dems
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 24, 2026
                            7:56 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 25, 2026
                                4:26 AM PST
                                    
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    CNN
          
    
          Donald Trump turned his State of the Union into an all-out brawl Tuesday night as he attacked Democrats, calling them "crazy" and accusing them of cheating elections.
      
    
          Trump severely divided the room by asking the audience to stand if they believed America's first mission was to protect American citizens. Many Democrats remained seated while Trump scowled at them.
      
    
          "You should be ashamed of yourselves," he said.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          At one point, Rep. Ilhan Omar shouted, "You've killed Americans" ... to which Trump repeated, "You should be ashamed of yourself."
      
    
          Earlier, Trump went specifically after Nancy Pelosi.
      
    
          During a rare bipartisan applause about not letting politicians profit from insider information, Trump was taken aback by the support he was getting from across the aisle.
      
    
      
      Trump on calling for a stop to congressional insider trading: “Did Nancy Pelosi stand up? Doubt it.” pic.twitter.com/N4HaMX6pZl
              @ZhouJaron
          
  
    
          He said, "They stood up, and I can't believe it."
      
    
          He added, "Did Nancy Pelosi stand up if she's here?"
      
    
          Nancy served as the 52nd speaker of the House of Representatives and is set to retire from office in January 2027. This was the last SOTU of her career, but Trump couldn't help but take one more jab.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell Smelled Foul at Florida Prison, Former Inmate Says
description:
Ghislaine Maxwell
                          Pee Yew ... You Smell Rank In Prison!!!
body:
Ghislaine Maxwell
                          Pee Yew ... You Smell Rank In Prison!!!
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 24, 2026
                            4:33 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 25, 2026
                                4:17 AM PST
                                    
              
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Ghislaine Maxwell is a real stinker in federal prison ... as a matter of fact, she smells like "armpits," according to one inmate who knows her well.
      
    
          The female inmate -- who we confirmed was incarcerated with Maxwell from 2023 to 2025 -- had daily contact with the convicted child sex trafficker at FCI Tallahassee in Florida ... and it was a smelly experience, to say the least.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Maxwell was transferred to FCI Tallahassee in 2022 after she was convicted on sex trafficking and other charges for conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors. A judge sentenced her to 20 years in federal prison.
      
    
          The inmate -- who only spoke on the condition of anonymity while still in Bureau of Prisons custody -- tells us Maxwell "has horrible personal hygiene" and "would shower once or twice a week," despite prisoners having regular access to the shower facilities.  
      

          The inmate said Maxwell "always had BO" because she would work out all the time and rarely wash herself afterwards. Maxwell always jogged around the recreation yard or walked briskly around the compound to get where she was going, according to the inmate.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    MEGA
          
    
          Last July, TMZ published paparazzi photos of Maxwell, along with a video of her breaking a sweat as she went for a run on prison grounds.
      
    
          And get this ... the inmate said Maxwell's reputation also reeked ... her fellow prisoners categorized her as a "Chomo" (child molester) -- because of her conviction charges -- and offered her little respect.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          But, the inmate insists, Maxwell was never assaulted at FCI Tallahassee because no one wanted to get sent to the Special Housing Unit -- better known as "the hole" -- which is "very hard living."
      
    
          The inmate said "the hole" acted as a deterrent to others thinking of assaulting Maxwell because you're confined 24 hours a day to your cell with cold food for months. She noted, "It's just not worth it."
      
    
          In August 2025, Maxwell was sent to the Federal Prison Camp in Bryan, Texas, to serve out the rest of her sentence after her meetings with Deputy U.S. Attorney General Todd Blanche regarding the Epstein case.
      
    
                    
                          
                                  
      
        
    
          Blanche conducted two days of interviews with Maxwell about Epstein's network of high-profile associates ... namely President Trump. Maxwell denied Trump had committed any crimes with Epstein.
      
    
          We reached out to Maxwell's attorneys for comment ... so far, no word back.

schema.headline: Ghislaine Maxwell Smelled Foul at Florida Prison, Former Inmate Says
